body_html:
found out why its not working in the virtual env:
in tf_tests.cmake we use:
add_test(NAME ${sourcefile} COMMAND ${PYTHON_EXECUTABLE} ${sourcefile})

but that PYTHON_EXECUTABLE is not in the virtual env that you install the pip in.
There are 2 options to fix it:

  1. we call cmake and set PYTHON_EXECUTABLE to the python in the virtual env
  2. we use 'python' in tf_tests.cmake, than it will take python from $PATH which would be the virtual env

we use 'python' in tf_tests.cmake, than it will take python from $PATH which would be the virtual env
body:
found out why its not working in the virtual env:
in tf_tests.cmake we use:
     add_test(NAME ${sourcefile} COMMAND ${PYTHON_EXECUTABLE} ${sourcefile})

but that PYTHON_EXECUTABLE is not in the virtual env that you install the pip in. 
There are 2 options to fix it:
1. we call cmake and set PYTHON_EXECUTABLE to the python in the virtual env
2. we use 'python' in tf_tests.cmake, than it will take python from $PATH which would be the virtual env
